verses.devanagari:
oṁ namo bhagavate vāsudevāya
janmādy asya yataḥ sṛṣṭi-sthiti-layāḥ
satyasya jñānānandasya brahmaṇaḥ
paramātmanaḥ
verses.iast:
oṁ namo bhagavate vāsudevāya
janmādy asya yataḥ sṛṣṭi-sthiti-layāḥ
satyasya jñānānandasya brahmaṇaḥ
paramātmanaḥ
verses.translation: Om! I bow to the blessed Lord Vāsudeva, the Supreme Self, from whom arise creation, preservation, and dissolution, who is truth, knowledge, and bliss.

verses.devanagari:
viṣṇoḥ paramaṁ rūpaṁ sattvarūpaṁ sanātanam
śuddhaṁ sac-cid-ānandaṁ yad brahma paramaṁ viduḥ
verses.iast:
viṣṇoḥ paramaṁ rūpaṁ sattva-rūpaṁ sanātanam
śuddhaṁ sac-cid-ānandaṁ yad brahma paramaṁ viduḥ
verses.translation: The supreme form of Viṣṇu is eternal, pure existence-consciousness-bliss, composed of sattva, which the wise know as the highest Brahman.

verses.devanagari:
sa eva sarvabhūtānām ādikartā sanātanaḥ
vedavedāntaveditvaṁ tena sarvam idaṁ jagat
verses.iast:
sa eva sarvabhūtānām ādikartā sanātanaḥ
veda-vedānta-veditvaṁ tena sarvam idaṁ jagat
verses.translation: He alone, eternal, is the prime creator of all beings. Knowing the Veda and Vedānta, He pervades the entire universe.

verses.devanagari:
eko vai nārāyaṇa āsīn na brahmā neśānaḥ
na ca sūryo na ca candraḥ na nakṣatrāṇi
verses.iast:
eko vai nārāyaṇa āsīn na brahmā neśānaḥ
na ca sūryo na ca candraḥ na nakṣatrāṇi
verses.translation: In the beginning, only Nārāyaṇa existed—neither Brahmā nor Śiva, nor sun, nor moon, nor stars.

verses.devanagari:
na dyaur na pṛthivī nāpo na vāyur na ca vahniḥ
nāyamaśo na dik tasmād nānyad kiñcid vyavasthitam
verses.iast:
na dyaur na pṛthivī nāpo na vāyur na ca vahniḥ
nāyamaśo na dik tasmād nānyad kiñcid vyavasthitam
verses.translation: There was no heaven, no earth, no waters, no air, no fire, no quarters of space, nothing else whatsoever.

verses.devanagari:
tama evaika evāsīt tadātmānam avīkṣata
sa āsīt puruṣo viṣṇus tasya śaktiḥ parā parā
verses.iast:
tama evaika evāsīt tadātmānam avīkṣata
sa āsīt puruṣo viṣṇus tasya śaktiḥ parā parā
verses.translation: Only darkness existed, contemplating its own nature. That was the Supreme Person, Viṣṇu, with His supreme energy.

verses.devanagari:
sa eva sarvabhūtānāṁ kāraṇaṁ prakṛtir hi yā
avyaktā kālarūpeṇa vyaktā vyaktikaraṇy api
verses.iast:
sa eva sarvabhūtānāṁ kāraṇaṁ prakṛtir hi yā
avyaktā kālarūpeṇa vyaktā vyaktikaraṇy api
verses.translation: He is the cause of all beings. His energy, called prakṛti, is unmanifest as time, yet manifests all things.

verses.devanagari:
tasyāḥ saṁkṣobhakartā vai viṣṇur eva janārdanaḥ
sa hi dhātā vidhātā ca lokānāṁ sampravartakaḥ
verses.iast:
tasyāḥ saṁkṣobhakartā vai viṣṇur eva janārdanaḥ
sa hi dhātā vidhātā ca lokānāṁ sampravartakaḥ
verses.translation: It is Janārdana Viṣṇu who agitates that energy, being the creator and sustainer, the mover of all worlds.

verses.devanagari:
sa eva dharmakartā ca sa eva paripālakaḥ
sa eva lokanāthas tu sa eva śaraṇaṁ vibhuḥ
verses.iast:
sa eva dharmakartā ca sa eva paripālakaḥ
sa eva lokanāthas tu sa eva śaraṇaṁ vibhuḥ
verses.translation: He is the ordainer of dharma, its protector, the Lord of the worlds, and the refuge of all beings.

verses.devanagari:
sarveṣām eva bhūtānāṁ nātho viṣṇur janārdanaḥ
tasya prasādāt sarveṣu sukhaṁ śāntiś ca jāyate
verses.iast:
sarveṣām eva bhūtānāṁ nātho viṣṇur janārdanaḥ
tasya prasādāt sarveṣu sukhaṁ śāntiś ca jāyate
verses.translation: Viṣṇu Janārdana is the Lord of all beings. By His grace arise happiness and peace everywhere.
